languageKey.label: Commented record

Displays commented page or, if commenting on records like news, the commented record. Manual change of this value is risky, the new record must be suitable. This means for example that the new page already should contain the plugin, or on the page for the records, the plugin must be present.
tx_toctoc_comments_comments:external_ref_uid
Title of the content element

Displays the header of the content element which holds the plug-in. As you can select any content element you want, make sure that in case of changes to this field, the new content element holds the plugin as well!
tx_toctoc_comments_comments:external_ref
Approval by system or moderator
Comments must be approved by system or moderator in order to be displayed. Check this box to approve comments.
First name
Commenter's first name.
Last name
Commenter's last name. Use this field as Alias or single Name field if you don't want to use the first name field
Email
Commenter's email.
Location
Commenter's location (where he comes from).
Web site
Commenter's web site.
Comment
This is a text as entered by commenter.
IP address
This is the IP address of the host from which this rating was made.
IP address
This is the IP address of the host from which this comment was made. If you plan to use this information for access limitation, check that it is not a proxy or you can block lots of innocent people.
TocToc Comments User id
The internal ID for user identification is either based on IP or on fe_users uid. It's also referred as 'TocToc user id'. This ID must be in format IP.0 or 0.0.0.0.fe_users.uid
uid of Frontend user
The fe_users.uid of the user who created the comment. It's set to 0 for users who leave comments without login.
Notify about new comments

The user want to be notified about new comments. On new comments an email will be sent to him, with a link to the new comment. Email notification only works if the new comment is automatically approved or approved from the admin email. It's not working when changing data in the backend.
External prefix for this comment

The external prefix is set by TS option and identifies the TYPO3 table for which the comment was made. 'pages' in fact means tt_content without associated records from another table. Any other prefix indicated that the comment is associated to this table and, as always, to the content element holding the comment.
tx_toctoc_comments_comments:external_ref
Positive rating
An iLike is a positive rating on a comment or record.
Negative rating
An iDislike is a negative rating on a comment or record.
Rating on a scale of stars
Ratings made with the ratings bar (rating-stars) are stored as 'Myratings'.
Sum of ratings with the stars
Sum of the ratings made with the ratings bar (rating-stars) are stored as 'Myratings'.
Number of votes
Total number of votes made for this item.
Date of email opt-in
The date of opt-in is filled as soon the user confirms his email address. The confirmation process does only check the email, not the IP.
email to be confirmed by email
When an opt-in is requested the email is filled and the IP of the request
IP from where the email opt-in was made
When a user tries to comment from another IP then he will have to reconfirm his email
Word identified as Spam
This word is identified as possible spam and therefore will get the associated spam values - this is for evaluation if a comment is spam or not.
Spampoints for this word
When a Spamword appears in a comment it will get this number of spam points.
tx_toctoc_comments_comments:spamword
Language
Language for which this spam word is defined.
Type of attachment
1 is webpage preview, 2 is image, 3 is video, 4 is general document (pdf, doc..)
Optional URL of the attachment

For webpage previews the URL as returned by the webserver is stored here. The URL the User entered is in table attachment_mm - it is linked to the System-URL by the relation to the corresponding record in the table here (attachment).
Main image
The main image for an attachment is the website-logo (for webpages, if a logo is found), for image-attachments it's the uploaded image.
Additional images for the attachment
For a webpage preview here the found images are stored.
Attachment title
Title of the attachment.
Attachment file size in bytes
The size of the file is used for display in frontend. For images and pdf different limits can be given in TS with picUploadMaxfilesize and pdfUploadMaxfilesize (in the options values are in Kbytes)
Attachment description
Description or illustrating Text for the attachment.
pi1 extension key
The extension key for which the prefix to table map is valid.
Extensiontable
Table where pi1 plugin stores records
Url parameter
Some extensions may use url parameter other than showUid to show a record. showUid is used by default, if the extension uses another parameter you can specify it here
User saw this element
When a user first time sees a comment or plugin, after 3 seconds, the view is recorded here
TYPO3 page id of the view
Also the TYPO3 page id of the view is recorded and used later in charts for links
Time of the view
The exact date time when the user first saw the element
Time of the like
The exact date time when the user liked the element
Time of the dislike
The exact date time when the user disliked the element
Time of the rating
The exact date time when the user rated the element
TYPO3 page id of the like
The TYPO3 page id of the like is recorded and used later in charts for links
TYPO3 page id of the dislike
The TYPO3 page id of the dislike is recorded and used later in charts for links
TYPO3 page id of the rating
The TYPO3 page id of the rating is recorded and used later in charts for links
Fields to display in top ratings list and other charts

For selecting topRatings data on records like News or Products toctoc_comments needs to know which fields of the record to display. In displayfields you can specify title, time of the record, the content (will be cropped) and you can specify if toctoc_comments should use translated records (in the same records table) with sys_languahe_uid, also you can specify the name of the field holding an image for display. A displayfield has the following syntax Field for title [filed for time] [field for image] [field for sys_language_uid], [field for content] for tt_news it looks like this: title tstamp image sys_language_uid, short
Folder with images to display in top ratings list and other charts

If in displayfileds an image is specified, then we need to now the folder containing the images of the extension, Normally this is uploads/pics/, but it can be another folder which can be specified here.
Force a detail page for top ratings and other charts

Some website allow their records to be rated on overview pages and also on detailpages. It concerns mainly the extensions tt_products and tt_news. So linking the rated item to the overview page is a bad idea - here you can force the page which displays the detail records.
